alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 19 at 11:51PM CDT until April 20 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1151 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles south of Okfuskee, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Hoffman... Clearview... Okmulgee State Park... Pharoah... Bryant... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 219 and 243. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
